definitions.definition: of, relating to, or caused by a projection
Of or related to projective geometry :

labels: of a property of a geometric object
subdefinitions.label_groups: now usually in set phrases , of a property of a geometric object , figure , etc.

subdefinitions.definition: Defined in or inhabiting a projective space .
subdefinitions.label_groups: of a geometric object, figure, etc.

definitions.definition: In a technical sense, general (but not necessarily so general as to be free ); involving such objects:

subdefinitions.definition: module M {\displaystyle M} over a ring R {\displaystyle R} ) Such that there is another (left) R {\displaystyle R} -module N {\displaystyle N} with M ⊕ N {\displaystyle M\oplus N} a free R {\displaystyle R} -module. Equivalently, projective in the category of modules (see below).

Such that, given an epimorphism e : E → X {\displaystyle e:E\to X} and morphism f : P → X {\displaystyle f:P\to X} , f {\displaystyle f} factors through e {\displaystyle e} ; that is, there exists a morphism f ~ : P → E {\displaystyle {\tilde {f}}:P\to E} with e ∘ f ~ = f {\displaystyle e\circ {\tilde {f}}=f} .
labels: of an object P {\displaystyle P} in a category
subdefinitions.label_groups: category theory , most generally , of an object P {\displaystyle P} in a category

subdefinitions.definition: Such that every epimorphism from a profinite group onto G {\displaystyle G} has a right inverse which is a homomorphism .
labels: of a profinite group G {\displaystyle G}
subdefinitions.label_groups: group theory , of a profinite group G {\displaystyle G}

subdefinitions.definition: Such that every object in the resolution is projective.
